pullRequest.title: Feature/GEODE-7414_2_redo
pullRequest.bodyText:
I think this needs polish, because we have to specify the exemption 3 times for what (to me) is the same change. I would rather write better logic into GeodeApiRegressionRule that would make the JSON exemption spec easier on developers.
Comments?

nodes.bodyText:
I would like to see some javadoc comments explaining both

why a breaking change was justified, and
documentation of property names and suitable values for each that need to be in this Properties object

commit.message:
GEODE-7414_2: modify init() method argument (#5040)

(cherry picked from commit 5f9800b291d3a11140eb5a1a972459207e07b50c)

Add exemption for SSLParameterExtension API change

Following feedback on the SSLParameterExtension
Accept a map of <enum,object> as a more definite set of inputs than
'Properties'. Extend as needed.

Authored-by: Robert Houghton <rhoughton@pivotal.io>

afterCommit.message:
Add exemption for SSLParameterExtension API change

Following feedback on the SSLParameterExtension
Accept a map of <enum,object> as a more definite set of inputs than
'Properties'. Extend as needed.

Authored-by: Robert Houghton <rhoughton@pivotal.io>

nodes.bodyText: While this addresses the compile time discovery of the value it doesn't address its typing or issues with runtime existence of the value in the map like a concrete object would. The Map contract on get says it will return null if the key does not exist. At runtime I must check for null results and respond appropriately. A non-null value must then be cast to the correct type at runtime, possibly resulting an a runtime exception. What initializes this Map with default values? If we address all those issue we now have a class.

commit.message: Applying feedback to use a real class to hold TLS context

nodes.bodyText: is it necessary for this to be a mutable class?  I don't see setDistributedSystemId called anywhere.  If the constructor and getter are sufficient, I would discourage a setter...
The impl class needs to be in an "internal" package for convention or made package private to the factory that creates it.

commit.message: move SSLParameterExtensionContextImpl to an internal package
prune un-needed value from exception list
fixup - remove now-internal javadoc from assembly
